detail.usage: A tag can trigger an automation when scanned, you can use NFC tags, QR codes or any other kind of tag. Use our {companion_link} to write this tag to a programmable NFC tag or create a QR code below.

energy.caption: Energy
energy.description: Monitor your energy production and consumption
energy.new_device_info: After setting up a new device, it can take up to 2 hours for new data to arrive in your energy dashboard.
energy.delete_source: Are you sure you want to delete this source?
energy.delete_integration: Are you sure you want to delete this integration? It will remove the entities it provides

grid.title: Electricity grid
grid.sub: Configure the amount of energy that you consume from the grid and, if you produce energy, give back to the grid. This allows Home Assistant to track your whole home energy usage.
grid.learn_more: More information on how to get started.

from.paragraph: Grid consumption is the energy that flows from the energy grid to your home.
from.entity_para: Pick a sensor which measures grid consumption in either of {unit}.
from.cost_para: Select how Home Assistant should keep track of the costs of the consumed energy.
from.cost_stat: Use an entity tracking the total costs
from.cost_entity: Use an entity with current price

to.paragraph: Grid production is the energy that flows from your solar panels to the grid.
to.entity_para: Pick a sensor which measures grid production in either of {unit}.
to.cost_para: Do you get money back when you return energy to the grid?
to.no_cost: I do not get money back
to.cost_stat: Use an entity tracking the total recieved money
to.cost_entity: Use an entity with current rate

solar.title: Solar Panels
solar.sub: Let Home Assistant monitor your solar panels and give you insight on their performance.
solar.learn_more: More information on how to get started.
solar.stat_return_to_grid: Solar energy returned to the grid
solar.stat_predicted_production: Prediction of your solar energy production

dialog.entity_para: Pick a sensor which measures solar energy production in either of {unit}.
dialog.solar_production_forecast_description: Adding solar production forecast information will allow you to quickly see your expected production for today.

battery.title: Home Battery Storage
battery.sub: If you have a battery system, you can configure it to monitor how much energy was stored and used from your battery.
battery.learn_more: More information on how to get started.

dialog.entity_para: Pick sensors which measure energy going in to and out of the battery in either of {unit}.
dialog.energy_into_battery: Energy going in to the battery
dialog.energy_out_of_battery: Energy coming out of the battery

gas.title: Gas Consumption
gas.sub: Let Home Assistant monitor your gas usage.
gas.learn_more: More information on how to get started.

dialog.paragraph: Gas consumption is measured either as the volume of gas that flows to your home or as the amount of energy contained in the gas.
dialog.entity_para: Pick a sensor which measures gas consumption in either of {unit}.
dialog.note_para: Note: It is not possible to add both sensors measuring a volume of gas and sensors measuring the amount of energy contained in the gas.
dialog.cost_para: Select how Home Assistant should keep track of the costs of the consumed gas.

water.title: Water Consumption
water.sub: Let Home Assistant monitor your water usage.
water.learn_more: More information on how to get started.

dialog.paragraph: Water consumption is the volume of water that flows to your home.
dialog.entity_para: Pick a sensor which measures water consumption in either of {unit}.
dialog.cost_para: Select how Home Assistant should keep track of the costs of the consumed water.

device_consumption.title: Individual devices
device_consumption.sub: Tracking the energy usage of individual devices allows Home Assistant to break down your energy usage by device.
device_consumption.learn_more: More information on how to get started.
device_consumption.add_stat: Pick entity to track energy of

dialog.selected_stat_intro: Select the energy sensor that measures the device's energy usage in either of {unit}.

devices.introduction: Add the devices that you want to be included in your scene. Set all entities in each device to the state you want for this scene.

cloud.description_features: Control home when away and integrate with Alexa and Google Assistant

login.title: Cloud Login
login.introduction: Home Assistant Cloud provides you with a secure remote connection to your instance while away from home. It also allows you to connect with cloud-only services: Amazon Alexa and Google Assistant.
login.introduction2: This service is run by our partner
login.introduction2a: , a company founded by the founders of Home Assistant.
login.introduction3: Home Assistant Cloud is a subscription service with a free one month trial. No payment information necessary.
login.learn_more_link: Learn more about Home Assistant Cloud
login.alert_password_change_required: You need to change your password before logging in.
login.alert_email_confirm_necessary: You need to confirm your email before logging in.

forgot_password.title: Forgot password
forgot_password.subtitle: Forgot your password
forgot_password.instructions: Enter your email address and we will send you a link to reset your password.
forgot_password.check_your_email: Check your email for instructions on how to reset your password.

register.title: Register Account
register.headline: Start your free trial
register.information: Create an account to start your free one month trial with Home Assistant Cloud. No payment information necessary.
register.information2: The trial will give you access to all the benefits of Home Assistant Cloud, including:
register.feature_remote_control: Control of Home Assistant away from home
register.feature_webhook_apps: Easy integration with webhook-based apps like OwnTracks
register.information3: This service is run by our partner
register.information3a: , a company founded by the founders of Home Assistant.
register.information4: By registering an account you agree to the following terms and conditions.
register.account_created: Account created! Check your email for instructions on how to activate your account.

account.thank_you_note: Thank you for being part of Home Assistant Cloud. It's because of people like you that we are able to make a great home automation experience for everyone. Thank you!
account.sign_out_confirm: Are you sure you want to sign out?
account.integrations_introduction: Integrations for Home Assistant Cloud allow you to connect with services in the cloud without having to expose your Home Assistant instance publicly on the internet.

tts.title: Text to Speech
tts.info: Bring personality to your home by having it speak to you by using our Text-to-Speech services. You can use this in automations and scripts by using the {service} service.

dialog.example_message: Hello {name}, you can play any text on any supported media player!

remote.title: Remote Control
remote.access_is_being_prepared: Remote control is being prepared. We will notify you when it's ready.
remote.info: Home Assistant Cloud provides a secure remote connection to your instance while away from home.
remote.instance_is_available: Your instance is available at your
remote.instance_will_be_available: Your instance will be available at your

alexa.title: Alexa
alexa.info: With the Alexa integration for Home Assistant Cloud you'll be able to control all your Home Assistant devices via any Alexa-enabled device.
alexa.enable_ha_skill: Enable the Home Assistant skill for Alexa
alexa.info_state_reporting: If you enable state reporting, Home Assistant will send all state changes of exposed entities to Amazon. This allows you to always see the latest states in the Alexa app and use the state changes to create routines.
alexa.not_configured_text: Before you can use Alexa, you need to activate the Home Assistant skill for Alexa in the Alexa app.

google.title: Google Assistant
google.info: With the Google Assistant integration for Home Assistant Cloud you'll be able to control all your Home Assistant devices via any Google Assistant-enabled device.
google.http_use_ssl_warning_text: Google devices will not be able to talk locally with Home Assistant because you have configured an SSL certificate for your HTTP integration.
google.enable_ha_skill: Activate the Home Assistant Cloud skill for Google Assistant
google.info_state_reporting: If you enable state reporting, Home Assistant will send all state changes of exposed entities to Google. This speeds up voice commands and allows you to always see the latest states in the Google app.
google.enter_pin_info: Please enter a PIN to interact with security devices. Security devices are doors, garage doors and locks. You will be asked to say/enter this PIN when interacting with such devices via Google Assistant.
google.enter_pin_hint: Enter a PIN to use security devices
google.not_configured_text: Before you can use Google Assistant, you need to activate the Home Assistant Cloud skill for Google Assistant in the Google Home app.

webhooks.title: Webhooks
webhooks.info: Anything that is configured to be triggered by a webhook can be given a publicly accessible URL to allow you to send data back to Home Assistant from anywhere, without exposing your instance to the internet.
webhooks.no_hooks_yet: Looks like you have no webhooks yet. Get started by configuring a
webhooks.link_learn_more: Learn more about creating webhook-powered automations.

google.title: Google Assistant
google.banner: Editing which entities are exposed via this UI is disabled because you have configured entity filters in configuration.yaml.
google.manage_defaults_dialog_description: Entities can be exposed by default based on their type.
google.sync_failed_text: Syncing your entities failed, try again or check the logs.

dialog_cloudhook.managed_by_integration: This webhook is managed by an integration and cannot be disabled.
dialog_cloudhook.info_disable_webhook: If you no longer want to use this webhook, you can

devices.enabled_description: Disabled devices will not be shown and entities belonging to the device will be disabled and not added to Home Assistant.

automation.no_device_automations: There are no automations available for this device.

devices.cant_edit: You can only edit items that are created in the UI.
devices.confirm_rename_entity_ids: Do you also want to rename the entity IDs of your entities?
devices.confirm_rename_entity_ids_warning: This will not change any configuration (like automations, scripts, scenes, dashboards) that is currently using these entities! You will have to update them yourself to use the new entity IDs!

picker.introduction: Home Assistant keeps a registry of every entity it has ever seen that can be uniquely identified. Each of these entities will have an entity ID assigned which will be reserved for just this entity.
picker.introduction2: Use the entity registry to override the name, change the entity ID or remove the entry from Home Assistant.

enable_selected.confirm_text: This will make them available in Home Assistant again if they are now disabled.

disable_selected.confirm_text: Disabled entities will not be added to Home Assistant.

remove_selected.confirm_text: You should remove them from your dashboard config and automations if they contain these entities.
remove_selected.confirm_partly_text: You can only remove {removable} of the selected {selected} entities. Entities can only be removed when the integration is no longer providing the entities. Sometimes you have to restart Home Assistant before you can remove the entities of a removed integration. Are you sure you want to remove the removable entities?

hide_selected.confirm_text: Hidden entities will not be shown on your dashboard. Their history is still tracked and you can still interact with them with services.

person.caption: People
person.description: Manage the people that Home Assistant tracks
person.introduction: Here you can add each person of interest in Home Assistant.
person.note_about_persons_configured_in_yaml: People configured via configuration.yaml cannot be edited via the UI.
person.no_persons_created_yet: Looks like you have not added any people yet.
person.confirm_delete_text: This person will be permanently deleted and all devices belonging to this person will become unassigned.
person.person_not_found: We couldn't find the person you were trying to edit.

detail.name: Name
detail.device_tracker_intro: Select the devices that belong to this person.
detail.no_device_tracker_available_intro: When you have devices that indicate the presence of a person, you will be able to assign them to a person here. You can add your first device by adding a presence-detection integration from the integrations page.
detail.confirm_delete_user: Are you sure you want to delete the user account for {name}? You can still track the user, but the person will no longer be able to login.

zone.caption: Zones
zone.description: Manage the zones you want to track people in
zone.introduction: Zones allow you to specify certain regions on Earth. When a person is within a zone, the state will take the name from the zone. Zones can also be used as a trigger or condition inside automation setups.
zone.no_zones_created_yet: Looks like you have not added any zones yet.
zone.confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this zone?
zone.configured_in_yaml: Zones configured via configuration.yaml cannot be edited via the UI.
zone.edit_home_zone: The radius of the Home zone can't be edited from the frontend yet. Drag the marker on the map to move the home zone.
zone.edit_home_zone_narrow: The radius of the Home zone can't be edited from the frontend yet. The location can be changed from the general configuration.
zone.home_zone_core_config: The location of your home zone is editable from the general configuration page. The radius of the Home zone can't be edited from the frontend yet. Do you want to go to the general configuration?

detail.name: Name
detail.icon_error_msg: Icon should be in the format ''prefix:iconname'', for example: ''mdi:home''
detail.passive_note: Passive zones are hidden in the frontend and are not used as location for device trackers. This is useful if you just want to use it for automations.

integrations.caption: Integrations
integrations.description: Manage integrations with services or devices
integrations.confirm_new: Do you want to set up {integration}?
integrations.no_integrations: Seems like you don't have any integrations configured yet. Click on the button below to add your first integration!
integrations.note_about_integrations: No integrations matched your search, the integration you want to set up might not be available to set up via the UI yet.
integrations.rename_dialog: Edit the name of this config entry

ignore.confirm_ignore: Are you sure you don't want to set up this integration? You can undo this by clicking the 'Show ignored integrations' in the overflow menu on the top right.
ignore.confirm_delete_ignore: This will make the integration appear in your discovered integrations again when it gets discovered. This might require a restart or take some time.

application_credentials.delete_prompt: Would you like to also remove Application Credentials for this integration?
application_credentials.delete_detail: If you remove them, you will need to enter credentials when setting up the integration again. If you keep them, they will be used automatically when setting up the integration again or may be acccessed from the Application Credentials menu.

config_entry.delete_confirm_text: Its devices and entities will be permanently deleted.
config_entry.restart_confirm: Restart Home Assistant to finish removing this integration
config_entry.reload_restart_confirm: Restart Home Assistant to finish reloading this integration
config_entry.disable_restart_confirm: Restart Home Assistant to finish disabling this integration
config_entry.enable_restart_confirm: Restart Home Assistant to finish enabling this integration
config_entry.disable_confirm_text: Its devices and entities will be disabled.
config_entry.disable_error: Enabling or disabling of the integration failed
config_entry.disabled_polling: Automatic polling for updated data disabled

config_flow.yaml_only_title: This device cannot be added from the UI
config_flow.yaml_only: You can add this device by adding it to your ''configuration.yaml''. See the documentation for more information.
config_flow.no_config_flow: This integration does not support configuration via the UI. If you followed this link from the Home Assistant website, make sure you run the latest version of Home Assistant.
config_flow.not_all_required_fields: Not all required fields are filled in.

external_step.description: This step requires you to visit an external website to be completed.

loading.loading_flow: Please wait, starting configuration wizard for {integration}

config_flow.could_not_load: Config flow could not be loaded
config_flow.not_loaded: The integration could not be loaded, try to restart Home Assistant.
config_flow.supported_brand_flow: Support for {supported_brand} devices is provided by {flow_domain_name}. Do you want to continue?
config_flow.missing_zwave_zigbee: To add a {brand} device, you first need {supported_hardware_link} and the {integration} integration set up. If you already have the hardware then you can proceed with the setup of {integration}.
config_flow.missing_matter: To add a {brand} device, you first need the {integration} integration and {supported_hardware_link}. Do you want to proceed with the setup of {integration}?
config_flow.matter_mobile_app: You need to use the Home Assistant Companion app on your mobile phone to commission Matter devices.

users.caption: Users
users.description: Manage the Home Assistant user accounts
users.users_privileges_note: The user group feature is a work in progress. The user will be unable to administer the instance via the UI. We're still auditing all management API endpoints to ensure that they correctly limit access to administrators.

editor.caption: View user
editor.name: Display name
editor.local_only: Can only log in from the local network
editor.confirm_user_deletion_text: This user will be permanently deleted.

change_password.caption: Change password
change_password.password_changed: The password has been changed successfully.

application_credentials.caption: Application Credentials
application_credentials.description: Manage the OAuth Application Credentials used by Integrations

editor.caption: Add Credential
editor.description: OAuth is used to grant Home Assistant access to information on other websites without giving a passwords. This mechanism is used by companies such as Spotify, Google, Withings, Microsoft, and Twitter.
editor.missing_credentials: Setting up {integration} requires configuring application credentials.
editor.name: Name
editor.client_id_helper: Public identifier of the OAuth application

remove_selected.confirm_text: Application Credentials in use by an integration may not be removed.

thread.no_preferred_network: You don't have a preferred network yet.
thread.no_routers_otbr_network: No border routers where found, maybe the border router is not configured correctly. You can try to reset it to the factory settings.
thread.confirm_reset_border_router_text: This will reset the Home Assistant border router to its factory defaults and form a new Thread network. The old network may no longer be available, and any devices that were attached to this network may need to be recomissioned.
thread.confirm_set_dataset_border_router_text: This will reconfigure the Home Assistant border router to use a different Thread network. The old network may no longer be available, and any devices that were attached to this network may need to be recomissioned.
thread.otbr_config_failed: Failed to configure the border router
thread.confirm_delete_dataset_text: This network will be removed from Home Assistant.

add_device_page.pairing_mode: Make sure your devices are in pairing mode. Check the instructions of your device on how to do this.
add_device_page.discovered_text: Devices will show up here once discovered.
add_device_page.no_devices_found: No devices were found, make sure they are in pairing mode and keep them awake while Home Assistant is searching.

clusters.help_cluster_dropdown: Select a cluster to view attributes and commands.

cluster_commands.help_command_dropdown: Select a command to interact with.

device_pairing_card.INITIALIZED_status_text: The device is ready to use

groups.caption: Groups
groups.group_details: Here are all the details for the selected Zigbee group.
groups.create_group_details: Enter the required details to create a new Zigbee group

group_binding.group_picker_help: Select a group to issue a bind command.
group_binding.cluster_selection_help: Select clusters to bind to the selected group.
group_binding.bind_button_help: Bind the selected group to the selected device clusters.
group_binding.unbind_button_help: Unbind the selected group from the selected device clusters.

common.in_progress_inclusion_exclusion: Z-Wave JS is searching for devices

dashboard.introduction: Manage your Z-Wave network and Z-Wave devices

messages_tx.label: Messages TX
messages_tx.tooltip: Number of messages successfully sent to the controller

messages_rx.label: Messages RX
messages_rx.tooltip: Number of messages successfully received by the controller

messages_dropped_tx.label: Dropped Messages TX
messages_dropped_tx.tooltip: Number of messages from the controller that were dropped by the host

messages_dropped_rx.label: Dropped Messages RX
messages_dropped_rx.tooltip: Number of outgoing messages that were dropped because they could not be sent

nak.label: NAK
nak.tooltip: Number of messages that the controller did not accept

can.label: CAN
can.tooltip: Number of collisions while sending a message to the controller

timeout_ack.label: Timeout ACK
timeout_ack.tooltip: Number of transmission attempts where an ACK was missing from the controller

timeout_response.label: Timeout Response
timeout_response.tooltip: Number of transmission attempts where the controller response did not come in time

timeout_callback.label: Timeout Callback
timeout_callback.tooltip: Number of transmission attempts where the controller callback did not come in time

commands_tx.label: Commands TX
commands_tx.tooltip: # of commands successfully sent to the node

commands_rx.label: Commands RX
commands_rx.tooltip: # of commands received from the node, including responses to sent commands

commands_dropped_tx.label: Commands Dropped TX
commands_dropped_tx.tooltip: # of outgoing commands that were dropped because they could not be sent

commands_dropped_rx.label: Commands Dropped RX
commands_dropped_rx.tooltip: # of commands from the node that were dropped by the host

timeout_response.label: Timeout Response
timeout_response.tooltip: # of Get-type commands where the node's response did not come in time

rtt.label: RTT
rtt.tooltip: Average round-trip-time in ms of commands to this node

rssi.label: RSSI
rssi.tooltip: Average RSSI in dBm of frames received by this node

data_rate.label: Data Rate
data_rate.tooltip: The used data rate for this route

repeaters.label: Repeaters + RSSI
repeaters.tooltip: Which nodes are repeaters for this route and their RSSI

rssi.label: RSSI
rssi.tooltip: The RSSI of the ACK frame received by the controller

route_failed_between.label: Route Failed Between
route_failed_between.tooltip: The nodes between which the transmission failed most recently

node_config.introduction: Manage and adjust device specific configuration parameters for the selected device
node_config.attribution: Device configuration parameters and descriptions are provided by the {device_database}
node_config.battery_device_notice: Battery devices must be awake to update their config. Please refer to your device manual for instructions on how to wake the device.
node_config.set_param_queued: The parameter change has been queued, and will be updated when the device wakes up.

add_node.title: Add a Z-Wave Device
add_node.follow_device_instructions: Follow the directions that came with your device to trigger pairing on the device.
add_node.choose_inclusion_strategy: How do you want to add your device
add_node.qr_code_paragraph: If your device supports SmartStart you can scan the QR code for easy pairing.
add_node.inclusion_failed: The device could not be added.
add_node.check_logs: Please check the logs for more information.
add_node.provisioning_finished: The device has been added. Once you power it on, it will become available.
add_node.interview_started: The device is being interviewed. This may take some time.
add_node.interview_failed: The device interview failed. Additional information may be available in the logs.

provisioned.confirm_unprovision_title: Are you sure you want to unprovision the device?
provisioned.confirm_unprovision_text: If you unprovision the device it will not be added to Home Assistant when it is powered on. If it is already added to Home Assistant, removing the provisioned device will not remove it from Home Assistant.

S2_Unauthenticated.title: S2 Unauthenticated
S2_Unauthenticated.description: Like S2 Authenticated, but without verification that the correct device is included

S2_Authenticated.title: S2 Authenticated
S2_Authenticated.description: Example: Lighting, Sensors and Security Systems

S2_AccessControl.title: S2 Access Control
S2_AccessControl.description: Example: Door Locks and Garage Doors

S0_Legacy.title: S0 Legacy
S0_Legacy.description: Example: Legacy Door Locks without S2 support

remove_node.title: Remove a Z-Wave device
remove_node.introduction: Remove a device from your Z-Wave network, and remove the associated device and entities from Home Assistant.
remove_node.controller_in_exclusion_mode: Your Z-Wave controller is now in exclusion mode.
remove_node.follow_device_instructions: Follow the directions that came with your device to trigger exclusion on the device.
remove_node.exclusion_failed: The device could not be removed. Please check the logs for more information.
remove_node.exclusion_finished: Device {id} has been removed from your Z-Wave network.

remove_failed_node.title: Remove a Failed Z-Wave Device
remove_failed_node.introduction: Remove a failed device from your Z-Wave network. Use this if you are unable to exclude a device normally because it is broken.
remove_failed_node.in_progress: The device removal is in progress.
remove_failed_node.removal_finished: Device {id} has been removed from your Z-Wave network.
remove_failed_node.removal_failed: The device could not be removed from your Z-Wave network.

reinterview_node.title: Re-interview a Z-Wave Device
reinterview_node.introduction: Re-interview a device on your Z-Wave network. Use this feature if your device has missing or incorrect functionality.
reinterview_node.battery_device_warning: You will need to wake battery powered devices before starting the re-interview. Refer to your device's manual for instructions on how to wake the device.
reinterview_node.run_in_background: You can close this dialog and the interview will continue in the background.
reinterview_node.in_progress: The device is being interviewed. This may take some time.
reinterview_node.interview_failed: The device interview failed. Additional information may be available in the logs.

heal_network.title: Heal your Z-Wave Network
heal_network.introduction: Start a network heal on your Z-Wave network. A network heal will cause all devices to re-calculate their routes back to the controller and is recommended if you have recently moved devices or your controller.
heal_network.traffic_warning: The healing process generates a large amount of traffic on the Z-Wave network. This may cause devices to respond slowly (or not at all) while the heal is in progress.
heal_network.in_progress: Network healing is in progress. This will take some time.
heal_network.run_in_background: You can close this dialog and the network healing will continue in the background.
heal_network.healing_failed: Healing failed. Additional information may be available in the logs.

heal_node.title: Heal a Z-Wave Device
heal_node.introduction: Tell {device} to update its routes back to the controller. This can help with communication issues if you have recently moved the device or your controller.
heal_node.traffic_warning: The healing process generates a large amount of traffic on the Z-Wave network. This may cause devices to respond slowly (or not at all) while the heal is in progress.
heal_node.healing_failed_check_logs: Additional information may be available in the logs.
heal_node.network_heal_in_progress: A Z-Wave network heal is already in progress. Please wait for it to finish before healing an individual device.

update_firmware.title: Update Device Firmware
update_firmware.warning: WARNING: Firmware updates can brick your device if you do not correctly follow the manufacturer's guidance. The Home Assistant and Z-Wave JS teams do not take any responsibility for any damages to your device as a result of the firmware update and will not be able to help you if you brick your device. Would you still like to continue?
update_firmware.warning_controller: WARNING: Firmware updates can brick your controller if you do not use the right firmware files, or if you attempt to stop the firmware update before it completes. The Home Assistant and Z-Wave JS teams do not take any responsibility for any damages to your controller as a result of the firmware update and will not be able to help you if you brick your controller. Would you still like to continue?
update_firmware.introduction: Select the firmware file you would like to use to update {device}.
update_firmware.introduction_controller: Select the firmware file you would like to use to update {device}. Note that once you start a firmware update, you MUST wait for the update to complete.
update_firmware.firmware_target_intro: Select the firmware target (0 for the Z-Wave chip, ≥1 for other chips if they exist) for this update.
update_firmware.queued: The firmware update is ready to be sent to {device} but the device is asleep, wake the device to start the update.
update_firmware.close_queued: If you close this dialog, the update will continue to be queued in the background and start automatically once the device wakes up.
update_firmware.awake: The firmware update should start being sent to {device} shortly.
update_firmware.close: If you close this dialog, the update will continue in the background.
update_firmware.in_progress: The firmware update on {device} is in progress ({progress}%).
update_firmware.confirm_abort: Are you sure you want to abort the firmware update on {device}?

finished_status.try_again: To attempt the firmware update again, select the new firmware file you would like to use.
finished_status.done: The firmware update is complete! If you want to attempt another firmware update on this device, please wait until it gets re-interviewed.
finished_status.done_controller: The firmware update is complete! Your controller is being restarted and your network will temporarily be unavailable.

logs.title: Z-Wave JS Logs
logs.subscribed_to_logs: Subscribed to Z-Wave JS Log Messages…

tips.join: Join the community on our {forums}, {twitter}, {discord}, {blog} or {newsletter}

analytics.description: Learn how to share data to improve Home Assistant

base.title: Basic analytics
base.description: This includes information about your system.

usage.title: Usage
usage.description: Details of what you use with Home Assistant

statistics.title: Statistical data
statistics.description: Counts containing total number of datapoints.

diagnostics.title: Diagnostics
diagnostics.description: Share crash reports when unexpected errors occur.

analytics.need_base_enabled: You need to enable basic analytics for this option to be available
analytics.intro: Share anonymized information from your installation to help make Home Assistant better and help us convince manufacturers to add local control and privacy-focused features.

supervisor.title: Configure network interfaces
supervisor.warning: If you are changing the Wi-Fi, IP or gateway addresses, you might lose the connection!
supervisor.unsaved: You have unsaved changes, these will get lost if you change tabs, do you want to continue?

hostname.title: Host Name
hostname.description: The name your instance will have on your network

datadisk.title: Move datadisk
datadisk.description: You are currently using ''{current_path}'' as datadisk. Moving data disks will reboot your device and it's estimated to take {time} minutes. Your Home Assistant installation will not be accessible during this period. Do not disconnect the power during the move!
datadisk.no_devices_text: There is no suitable external device found. The storage capacity of the external data disk must be larger than the storage capacity of the existing disk
datadisk.moving_desc: Rebooting and moving datadisk. Please have patience

system_health.caption: System Health
system_health.description: Status, metrics and integration startup time

cards.confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this card?

actions.action_confirmation: Are you sure you want to run action ''{action}''?
actions.no_entity_more_info: No entity provided for more info dialog

empty_state.title: Welcome Home
empty_state.no_devices: This page allows you to control your devices, however it looks like you have no devices set up yet. Head to the integrations page to get started.

iframe.error_secure_context: Unable to load iframes pointing at websites using {target_protocol} if Home Assistant is served over {context_protocol}.

safe-mode.description: Home Assistant ran into trouble while loading your configuration and is now running in safe mode. Take a look at the error log to see what went wrong.

starting.description: Home Assistant is starting, please wait…

energy.no_data: There is no data to show. It can take up to 2 hours for new data to arrive after you configure your energy dashboard.
energy.no_data_period: There is no data for this period.

solar_consumed_gauge.card_indicates_solar_energy_used: This card indicates how much of the solar energy you produced was used by your home instead of being returned to the grid.
solar_consumed_gauge.card_indicates_solar_energy_used_charge_: If this number is typically very low, indicating excess solar production, you might want to consider charging a home battery or electric car from your solar panels at times of high solar production.
solar_consumed_gauge.not_produced_solar_energy: You have not produced any solar energy
solar_consumed_gauge.self_consumed_solar_could_not_calc: Self-consumed solar energy couldn't be calculated

grid_neutrality_gauge.energy_dependency: This card indicates your net energy usage.
grid_neutrality_gauge.color_explain: If the needle is in the purple, you returned more energy to the grid than you consumed from it. If it's in the blue, you consumed more energy from the grid than you returned.
grid_neutrality_gauge.grid_neutrality_not_calculated: Grid neutrality could not be calculated

carbon_consumed_gauge.card_indicates_energy_used: This card indicates how much of the energy consumed by your home was generated using non-fossil fuels like solar, wind and nuclear. The higher, the better!
carbon_consumed_gauge.low_carbon_energy_not_calculated: Consumed low-carbon energy couldn't be calculated

unused_entities.title: Unused entities
unused_entities.available_entities: These are the entities that you have available, but are not in your dashboard yet.
unused_entities.select_to_add: Select the entities you want to add to a card and then click the add card button.

add_entities.yaml_unsupported: You cannot use this function when using your dashboard in YAML mode.
add_entities.generated_unsupported: You can only use this function when you have taken control of your dashboard.

views.confirm_delete_text: Are you sure you want to delete your ''{name}'' view?
views.confirm_delete_existing_cards: Deleting this view will also remove the cards
views.confirm_delete_existing_cards_text: Are you sure you want to delete your ''{name}'' view? The view contains {number} cards that will be deleted. This action cannot be undone.

reload_resources.refresh_body: You have to refresh the page to complete the reload. Do you want to refresh now?

raw_editor.lovelace_changed: Your dashboard was updated, do you want to load the updated config in the editor and lose your current changes?
raw_editor.confirm_remove_config_title: Are you sure you want to remove your dashboard configuration?
raw_editor.confirm_remove_config_text: We will automatically generate your dashboard views with your areas and devices if you remove your dashboard configuration.
raw_editor.confirm_unsaved_changes: You have unsaved changes, are you sure you want to exit?
raw_editor.confirm_unsaved_comments: Your configuration might contains comment(s), these will not be saved. Do you want to continue?
raw_editor.resources_moved: Resources should no longer be added to the dashboard configuration but can be added in the dashboard config panel.

edit_lovelace.explanation: This title is shown above all your views in the dashboard.
edit_lovelace.title: Title

visibility.select_users: Select which users should see this view in the navigation

edit_view.subview_helper: Subviews don't appear in tabs and have a back button.

edit_badges.view_no_badges: Badges are not be supported by the current view type.

edit_card.pick_card: Which card would you like to add?
edit_card.pick_card_view_title: Which card would you like to add to your {name} view?
edit_card.confirm_cancel: Are you sure you want to cancel?

move_card.header: Choose a view to move the card to

suggest_card.header: We created a suggestion for you

save_config.para: This dashboard is currently being maintained by Home Assistant. It is automatically updated when new entities or dashboard components become available. If you take control, this dashboard will no longer be automatically updated. You can always create a new dashboard in configuration to play around with.
save_config.para_sure: Are you sure you want to take control of your user interface?
save_config.yaml_mode: You are using YAML mode for this dashboard, which means you cannot change your dashboard config from the UI. If you want to manage this dashboard from the UI, remove 'mode: yaml' from your dashboard configuration in 'configuration.yaml.'.
save_config.yaml_control: To take control in YAML mode, create a YAML file with the name you specified in your config for this dashboard, or the default 'ui-lovelace.yaml'.
save_config.yaml_config: To help you start here is the current config of this dashboard:

migrate.para_no_id: This element doesn't have an ID. Please add an ID to this element in 'ui-lovelace.yaml'.
migrate.para_migrate: Home Assistant can add IDs to all your cards and views automatically for you by pressing the 'Migrate configuration' button.

alarm-panel.name: Alarm Panel
alarm-panel.description: The Alarm Panel card allows you to arm and disarm your alarm control panel integrations.

area.name: Area
area.description: The Area card automatically displays entities of a specific area.
area.show_camera: Show camera feed instead of area picture

calendar.name: Calendar
calendar.description: The Calendar card displays a calendar including day, week and list views

conditional.name: Conditional
conditional.description: The Conditional card displays another card based on entity states.
conditional.condition_explanation: The card will be shown when ALL conditions below are fulfilled.

entities.name: Entities
entities.description: The Entities card is the most common type of card. It groups items together into lists.
entities.edit_special_row: View the details of this row by clicking the edit button

entity.name: Entity
entity.description: The Entity card gives you a quick overview of your entity's state.

button.name: Button
button.description: The Button card allows you to add buttons to perform tasks.
button.default_action_help: The default action depends on the entity's capabilities, it will either be toggled or the more info dialog will be shown.

entity-filter.name: Entity Filter
entity-filter.description: The Entity Filter card allows you to define a list of entities that you want to track only when in a certain state.

gauge.name: Gauge
gauge.description: The Gauge card is a basic card that allows visually seeing sensor data.

glance.name: Glance
glance.description: The Glance card is useful to group multiple sensors in a compact overview.

grid.name: Grid
grid.description: The Grid card allows you to show multiple cards in a grid.

logbook.name: Logbook
logbook.description: The Logbook card shows a list of events for entities.

history-graph.name: History Graph
history-graph.description: The History Graph card allows you to display a graph for each of the entities listed.

statistics-graph.name: Statistics Graph
statistics-graph.description: The Statistics Graph card allows you to display a graph of the statistics for each of the entities listed.

statistic.name: Statistic
statistic.description: The Statistic card allows you to display a statistical value of an entity of a certain period.

horizontal-stack.name: Horizontal Stack
horizontal-stack.description: The Horizontal Stack card allows you to stack together multiple cards, so they always sit next to each other in the space of one column.

humidifier.name: Humidifier
humidifier.description: The Humidifier card gives control of your humidifier entity. Allowing you to change the humidity and mode of the entity.

iframe.name: Webpage
iframe.description: The Webpage card allows you to embed your favorite webpage right into Home Assistant.

light.name: Light
light.description: The Light card allows you to change the brightness of the light.

generic.manual_description: Need to add a custom card or just want to manually write the YAML?
generic.name: Name
generic.title: Title

map.name: Map
map.description: The Map card that allows you to display entities on a map.

markdown.name: Markdown
markdown.description: The Markdown card is used to render Markdown.

media-control.name: Media Control
media-control.description: The Media Control card is used to display media player entities on an interface with easy to use controls.

picture.name: Picture
picture.description: The Picture card allows you to set an image to use for navigation to various paths in your interface or to call a service.

picture-elements.name: Picture Elements
picture-elements.description: The Picture Elements card is one of the most versatile types of cards. The cards allow you to position icons or text and even services! On an image based on coordinates.

picture-entity.name: Picture Entity
picture-entity.description: The Picture Entity card displays an entity in the form of an image. Instead of images from URL, it can also show the picture of camera entities.

picture-glance.name: Picture Glance
picture-glance.description: The Picture Glance card shows an image and corresponding entity states as an icon. The entities on the right side allow toggle actions, others show the more info dialog.

plant-status.name: Plant Status
plant-status.description: The Plant Status card is for all the lovely botanists out there.

sensor.name: Sensor
sensor.description: The Sensor card gives you a quick overview of your sensors state with an optional graph to visualize change over time.

shopping-list.name: Shopping List
shopping-list.description: The Shopping List card allows you to add, edit, check-off, and clear items from your shopping list.
shopping-list.integration_not_loaded: This card requires the `shopping_list` integration to be set up.

thermostat.name: Thermostat
thermostat.description: The Thermostat card gives control of your climate entity. Allowing you to change the temperature and mode of the entity.

tile.name: Tile
tile.description: The tile card gives you a quick overview of your entity. The card allow you to toggle the entity, show the more info dialog or custom actions.

features.name: Features
features.no_compatible_available: No compatible features available for this entity

vertical-stack.name: Vertical Stack

validation.heading: Check and Restart
validation.introduction: A basic validation of the configuration is automatically done before restarting. The basic validation ensures the YAML configuration doesn't have errors which will prevent Home Assistant or any integration from starting. It's also possible to only do the basic validation check without restarting.
validation.valid: Configuration will not prevent Home Assistant from starting!

reloading.heading: YAML configuration reloading
reloading.introduction: Some parts of Home Assistant can reload without requiring a restart. Clicking one of the options below will unload their current YAML configuration and load the new one.
reloading.group: Groups, group entities, and notify services

state.not_available: Add-on is not available on your system

network.introduction: Change the ports on your host that are exposed by the add-on

dashboard.not_available_arch: This add-on is not compatible with the processor of your device or the operating system you have installed on your device.

dashboard.visit_addon_page: Visit the {name} page for more details

protection_mode.title: Protection mode is disabled!
protection_mode.content: Protection mode on this add-on is disabled! This gives the add-on full access to the entire system, which adds security risks, and could damage your system when used incorrectly. Only disable the protection mode if you know, need AND trust the source of this add-on.

stage.title: Add-on Stage
stage.description:
Add-ons can have one of three stages:

{icon_stable} **Stable**: These are add-ons ready to be used in production.

{icon_experimental} **Experimental**: These may contain bugs, and may be unfinished.

{icon_deprecated} **Deprecated**: These add-ons will no longer receive any updates.

rating.title: Add-on Security Rating
rating.description:
Home Assistant provides a security rating to each of the add-ons, which indicates the risks involved when using this add-on. The more access an add-on requires on your system, the lower the score, thus raising the possible security risks.

A score is on a scale from 1 to 8. Where 1 is the lowest score (considered the most insecure and highest risk) and a score of 8 is the highest score (considered the most secure and lowest risk).

host_network.title: Host Network
host_network.description: Add-ons usually run in their own isolated network layer, which prevents them from accessing the network of the host operating system. In some cases, this network isolation can limit add-ons in providing their services and therefore, the isolation can be lifted by the add-on author, giving the add-on full access to the network capabilities of the host machine. This gives the add-on more networking capabilities but lowers the security, hence, the security rating of the add-on will be lowered when this option is used by the add-on.

homeassistant_api.title: Home Assistant API Access
homeassistant_api.description: This add-on is allowed to access your running Home Assistant instance directly via the Home Assistant API. This mode handles authentication for the add-on as well, which enables an add-on to interact with Home Assistant without the need for additional authentication tokens.

full_access.title: Full Hardware Access
full_access.description:
This add-on is given full access to the hardware of your system, by request of the add-on author. Access is comparable to the privileged mode in Docker. Since this opens up possible security risks, this feature impacts the add-on security score negatively.

This level of access is not granted automatically and needs to be confirmed by you. To do this, you need to disable the protection mode on the add-on manually. Only disable the protection mode if you know, need AND trust the source of this add-on.

hassio_api.title: Supervisor API Access
hassio_api.description: The add-on was given access to the Supervisor API, by request of the add-on author. By default, the add-on can access general version information of your system. When the add-on requests 'manager' or 'admin' level access to the API, it will gain access to control multiple parts of your Home Assistant system. This permission is indicated by this badge and will impact the security score of the add-on negatively.

docker_api.title: Full Docker Access
docker_api.description:
The add-on author has requested the add-on to have management access to the Docker instance running on your system. This mode gives the add-on full access and control to your entire Home Assistant system, which adds security risks, and could damage your system when misused. Therefore, this feature impacts the add-on security score negatively.

This level of access is not granted automatically and needs to be confirmed by you. To do this, you need to disable the protection mode on the add-on manually. Only disable the protection mode if you know, need AND trust the source of this add-on.

host_pid.title: Host Processes Namespace
host_pid.description:
Usually, the processes the add-on runs, are isolated from all other system processes. The add-on author has requested the add-on to have access to the system processes running on the host system instance, and allow the add-on to spawn processes on the host system as well. This mode gives the add-on full access and control to your entire Home Assistant system, which adds security risks, and could damage your system when misused. Therefore, this feature impacts the add-on security score negatively.

This level of access is not granted automatically and needs to be confirmed by you. To do this, you need to disable the protection mode on the add-on manually. Only disable the protection mode if you know, need AND trust the source of this add-on.

apparmor.title: AppArmor
apparmor.description:
AppArmor ('Application Armor') is a Linux kernel security module that restricts add-ons capabilities like network access, raw socket access, and permission to read, write, or execute specific files.

Add-on authors can provide their security profiles, optimized for the add-on, or request it to be disabled. If AppArmor is disabled, it will raise security risks and therefore, has a negative impact on the security score of the add-on.

auth_api.title: Home Assistant Authentication
auth_api.description: An add-on can authenticate users against Home Assistant, allowing add-ons to give users the possibility to log into applications running inside add-ons, using their Home Assistant username/password. This badge indicates if the add-on author requests this capability.

ingress.title: Ingress
ingress.description: This add-on is using Ingress to embed its interface securely into Home Assistant.

signed.title: Signed
signed.description: This add-on signed and verified with Codenotary Community Attestation Service (CAS).

boot.title: Start on boot
boot.description: Make the add-on start during a system boot

watchdog.title: Watchdog
watchdog.description: This will start the add-on if it crashes

auto_update.title: Auto update
auto_update.description: Auto update the add-on when there is a new version available

ingress_panel.title: Show in sidebar
ingress_panel.description: Add this add-on to your sidebar

protected.title: Protection mode
protected.description: Blocks elevated system access from the add-on

supervisor.share_diagnostics_description: Share crash reports and diagnostic information.
supervisor.share_diagonstics_description: Would you want to automatically share crash reports and diagnostic information when the Supervisor encounters unexpected errors? {line_break} This will allow us to fix the problems, the information is only accessible to the Home Assistant Core team and will not be shared with others.{line_break} The data does not include any private/sensitive information and you can disable this in settings at any time you want.
